SENT.plain: Peripheral erythrocytes of 5 patients with Behet's disease, not receiving systemic treatment, at the exacerbation stage, and those of 3 healthy controls were investigated with a transmission electron microscope
More than 100 cells were examined per subject
Cytolysosomes (autophagic vacuoles) were frequently observed in cells of the patients
The average frequency of appearance of cytolysosomes was 5.4 +/- 1.5% (mean +/- deviation) in erythrocytes of the 5 patients, and 0.5 +/- 0.4% in those of the 3 control subjects
These results suggest that cytolysosomes of erythrocytes may reflect abnormal production or removal involved in the pathophysiology of BehÃ§et's disease
